page.title: 03MR. WAITES' FAMILY
page.content: Mrs. Waites' grandparents lived in Scampton. They lived in a one cow cottage with three bedrooms. Mr. Waites' mother had nine children. Mr. Waites' father rented one acre of land half an acre of potatoes for home and pigs and half an acre of barley for the pigs. As a family they had many pets which included dogs, rabbits and pigeons. He likes the village but he does not know everybody as he once did. Mr. Waite met Mrs. Waite at Scampton school and they married in 1941. Mr. Waite went on the farm at 14 years of age. Then he became an apprentice radio fitter at Saxilby. Where he was paid 10/- a week. After a year he returned to the farm before joining the army in 1941 afterwards returning to the farm.
